Fields.DialogueText: All right, Köln. I wanted to talk to you about a special assignment.
What's that?
You mentioned how you wanted to learn from me as well. One thing I realized is that you have not had extensive leadership experience.
Wat wellste maache. I have learned to manage some of the Matrosen on Bord accordingly, ävver most of my experience has been training Rekruten.
I know, and none of that is your fault. So I was thinking that one thing we could do is gradually give you some leadership responsibilities out here.
... I have Zwiefel about that last part.
Stop. It's the right thing to do. I should delegate some of my duties anyway - there's a lot to manage in this campaign.
Ävver do you think that I am up for this? As I said, I have not had much firsthand experience in that Gebiet.

Fields.MenuText: It's okay. I couldn't think of anyone I trust more with that responsibility.
Well, the best way to learn is to try.
You'll learn how to take command, one step at a time.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke. That makes me feel really special.
Do häs Rääch. Just like Jefechte, I need to put myself out there and challenge myself.
Alsu jud. I see that you have picked up some of my Lihrstil.
Don't worry, I'll still be here for major issues.
Like Nixen?
Yes, of course.
You really have exzellente Instinkte for this life of ours.
Right. Well, it's time for me to get everyone ready.
I'll be watching you closely, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
That's because you are, Köln.
Hey, I learned from the best.
... They're closing in on us, aren't they?
... And, of course, there are Lück in power who object to Walküren assuming direct Kommandos. Especially me.
It might even convince Heimlich that you can be trusted.
At it again with your garden, I see. It's starting to take up a good portion of the deck!
Jo. It is very important that our extra food Reserve remains in top Kundizion.
That's certainly right. The extra reserves you've supplied really come in handy.
Danke! I just wish things were going better here...
Why? Are you running into issues with the garden?
@BATTLE
Herr Kapitän!
You tell me.
Herr Kapitän, I must protestieren!
... Gardening?
Ja! *Und* your proposal to give Fräulein Köln-
What was that, Hauptführer Heimlich?
... Your proposal to give Schiffsdame Köln more Einfluss over the Mannschaft! Can't you see she's a bad enough Einfluss already?

Fields.MenuText: Nope. Can't see it at all.
Seems to me it's exactly the opposite.
You're stepping on the carrots.

Fields.DialogueText: Haven't you read my Berichte?! My Aufzeichnungen are makellos!
Was?
Carrots.
... I apologize.
I think you'll find the duties our Schiffsdame is assuming are entirely consistent with INPF guidelines.
Aber...
I helped write the INPF guidelines. I know.
Mit allem Respekt, I still think it's a tödlich-
Hey, would you like to get your hands dirty? We were just saying the seed beds here could use a bit of attention.
... Nein. Verzeihung, but I have other Pflichten.
Oh, dear. Don't let us keep you, then.
... With your Erlaubnis, Herr Kapitän.
By all means.
You know, *you* could help with gääschnan, if you like.
... Great.
You will?
You're just lucky that dirt on your cheek makes you extra-charming. Could you pass me a trowel?
... een andere Mol, we have a Sturm coming, and it's not a natural one.
Verdammt! Takt's still off...
How's it going, Köln?
Jeht esu, I'm afraid. I was hoping to learn how to play a new style of Quetschbüggele while Heimlich is sleeping, ävver I'm having a little trouble.
Fancy that. I was actually thinking of asking you for lessons.
Nit with this thing. I hardly know where I'm putting my Finger.
Well, we can figure it out together. I like to think I've always had an intuitive knack for finger placement. I learned to play the oboe in an afternoon.
Besse secher, though?

Fields.MenuText: Hey, I want to do this. It'll be fun to explore the instrument together.
If we work together, we bounce our different insights off each other.
The more the merrier, I always say.

Fields.DialogueText: Jo, that would be scharmant.
Jude Tippel; after all, I did say we could learn a lot from each other.
As do I. It's always more juxich with Frünne.
You really want to do this with me?
Why not? I enjoy spending time with you.
Esu jud, then, let's give it another go!
That's the spirit! I'm right behind... actually, let's postpone this jazz session for a bit. We have some company...
Oh, I see what you mean. Those Nixen sour Musik like wet Knigg.
@BATTLE
Really?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a captain of many talents.
No.
I honestly don't know why I said that.

Fields.DialogueText: *giggle*
Dummkopf.
Es notiert!
I don't want to inconvenience you.
That's a metaphor I don't know.
Esu, I don't mind keeping you guessing.
Esu, now that things have settled down again, should we try to practice the Quetschbüggele - or should I say the Trikiti?
Either's good. But do we have enough instruments to both try?
Not to worry. I made sure to have a few extras in de Hinterhand.
In that case, let's hit it! Or pump it, that is.
Dat wollt isch och jrad saache. Here we go, straight from bovve!
Okay, that's enough for now. My ears can't take much more of yours - or mine, for the matter.
We need to improve some, I admit. Ävver hoffentlich, we can make Progress now that we're zosamme arbeide. What did you happen to spikeleere on how we should improve?

Fields.MenuText: I think you're overcompensating for the change in the instrument's size.
I think you're on the right track. Just work on improving a little more, and you'll be golden.
I think you need to adjust the thing slightly. The tone is off a bit.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke. I didn't notice that since I was fokussiert on spelle.
Großartig! I think that you're coming along okay as well.
I thought that might be the issue, ävver I wasn't sure. Danke for pointing it out.
So, any ways that I could improve as well?
Zunächst eenmol, you're holding it backwards.
Still, not bad for your first go at it. Plus, you gave me another Idee.
What's that?
The most exciting kinds of Musik come when you mix different sounds together. I think it would be interesting if we could play two different Instrumente together.
That sounds great. Let's get going at that - after we team up against the Morganas, that is.
@BATTLE
Time passes.

Fields.MenuText: Oops.
I did that with the oboe, too.

Fields.DialogueText: Pff!

Fields.MenuText: I thought *you* were.

Fields.DialogueText: If I was, I made it sound better than you playing it right.
Hey, stop making fun of your defenseless captain!
I will make no such Zusagen.
There you are, Köln. I was looking for you.
Wat es? More Föhrungstraining for me?
You're right on the mark. You know how we often have parties after we beat some of the Morganas?
Ja - secherlich! I wouldn't have it any other way.
Well, what I would like you to do is organize the next one.
I always do!
Incorrect. When the moment comes, you do all the work. And it's improvised.
It does sound like an interessante challenge.
I'm glad.
Still, do you think it will wörk out this way? Given how we adjust each Fier accordingly with the most recent Sieg, can we truly plan it out ahead räächziggig?

Fields.MenuText: You'll just have to try and find out.
It may be different from our usual festivities, but it will be one of your own design, and that has a unique flavor of its own.
That's part of the challenge.

Fields.DialogueText: Jo, do hääs Rääc. I won't know until I give it a go.
Danke. I'll be sure to make it spektakulär.
Jetz häs de mich. No way I can turn down a challenge.
So, think you're up for this?
You bet! I already have some Ideen I want to wörk on.
Good. Hopefully, you can get a plan in order before our next battle.
That might not be possible now, ävver I will make sure I think up one before we're through here.
@BATTLE
What I'm saying is, I want you to plan a party. I want you to delegate tasks to the appropriate crew members.
I want you to give me itemized lists of what we're going to consume. I want proposals and paperwork I could present to Heimlich and expect grudging approval.
... So, you want a Wunder.
Don't pretend you're not intrigued.
Köln, are you in here?
Ja - ävver don't pack anything aan! You... really don't want to set these things off.
What do you - wait, are these mines?
I have to store them somewhere, nit?
... Yes. But is this the best place?
I just need to make a few Aanpassunge to them, and then they'll be out of the Wäch again.
The sooner the better - and in the meantime we should put some notice up on the door.
I thought I might mol them some other Klör so they blend in with the Wasser besser.
I assume their designers thought of that, though.
Esu, I have the Zigg to improve on their wörk. The thought you put into each one does make a Ungerschied.
Are we still talking about mines, or something else now?
Both.

Fields.MenuText: Well, keep up the good work.
Just be careful not to trigger them while applying the paint.
Are the sea flowers on those ones really necessary, though?

Fields.DialogueText: Danke. I always do my Bestes.
I'll be extra dusemang, don't worry. You, on the other hand, might want to take a look at what you're leaning on.
It's a künslerische touch.
You did a really good job with them.
Ze scharmant. Still, it's almost a Schande to use them now.
That's what I was saying. Still, the best we can do is make sure they get put to good use.
Do häs Rääch. And I think the first opportunity is coming up; I think I hear a Flott' on its way.
@BATTLE
What the - sorry! That was a close shave.
Well, I never said it was a bad thing for it to be unnecessary.
Ah! Jude Idee!
So, what are you doing with them?
It might even be worth taking a few pictures for documentation. This is one of the more interesting low-budget R&D projects I've seen - as well as being the prettiest.
Hanging in there okay, Köln?
Ja! Natürlich!
Don't take this the wrong way - but that sounded a little bit forced.
... Ask me again when the fighting is done.
@BATTLE
I just finished looking over the damage reports. I can't believe I'm saying this, but they're not as bad as I was expecting.
You did an amazing job. And I know you must be uncomfortable, given all the shells exploding around you, but-
We need to do more Notfalldrills, Kapitän. I don't see how you could have gotten to safety if that Schlachtscheff had sunk me, and that's totally inakzeptabel.

Fields.MenuText: So don't get sunk.
... Are you okay?
If it'll make you feel better. Nothing the crew likes more than an extra set of drills, after all.

Fields.DialogueText: This isn't something to joke about.
This is ähnz!
I know ming Grenz. I will fight as hard as I can until my last Odemszoch, ävver no one would say I'm essenziell to the war effort. You are.
And my Schüler! I need to be sure that they can carry on without me, Kapitän. They can do so much Judes!
I know they can. In no small part because of what you're teaching them.
And, for the record, *I* would say you're essential to the war effort.
Kapitän...
If it's your considered opinion that we need more catastrophe drills, fine. But you're a better fighter than any Morgana - you just work harder - and I can't foresee ever having to leave you behind.
... And I'm honestly not sure that I could bring myself to leave you in the lurch anyway.
Well, that's just dumm.
No. It's not.
Esu jud. I suppose I have to stay afloat after all.
Glad we're on the same page.
Ävver-
It's not.
Minen anmalen! You're painting Minen! Mein Gott, you're not going to be content until your Albernheiten get someone killed, was?
Actually, I sent a Bericht on them to Oberkommando, and they seemed interessiert. As the Kapitän thought, the Idee that Feind-U-Boote might operate partially by sight was considered-
Why didn't you tell me this was the Kapitän's Idee? Do you enjoy wasting our time?
Hauptführer Heimlich. On your way out?
That's HauptSTURM... oh, never mind. Verzeihung, Kapitän. And viel Glück with your new Projekt.
... That guy.
Thanks for agreeing to play with me.
Gern geschehen! Why Schach, though?

I mean, it's chess. You probably already know the rules - and it's a good way for you to practice planning tactics. And since you're up against a live opponent, things will be a little more realistic.
How do you think I am coming along, by the way? Tactically?
Actually, I think that you do very well in a leadership position - some of our heavier-hitting Belles do noticeably better with your input.
Lehrer, actually - I enjoy the Koordination. I hope that I'm not stepping on your Föös, though.
Of course not - this isn't a competition. We're all trying to help each other improve.
Do häs Rääch, Kapitän. That's the best kind of lihre there, the kind that konstruktiv develops Individuen. If only the current set-up back home instilled those Ideale.
What do you mean?
Oh, nix. Come now, let us begin. Although, I have to ask, have you played Schach before?

Fields.MenuText: Nope, never.
A little, but I'm mostly an amateur.
Yes, I really enjoy the game.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't? Then how will we know how to spille?
Still, that's more than my own knowledge. I look forward to lihre more from you.
Oh? In that case, I look forward to the challenge.
So, white or black?
Hmm... I'll take - wait, RED!
Okay. I respect unconventional thinking, but unless you've got some paint handy-
Nä, I mean code red, hüchste Alarmstuf! There's a big Trupp of Nixen about to cut us off!
@BATTLE
We'll figure them out together as we go along.
Just the way I like it.
And, honestly, I thought it could be fun. In a productive kind of way.
We'll see if you still say that after we spelle.
Ha!
What's with the maps? Figuring out where our route is taking us?
Well, partially that, ävver I'm also luure at some potentielle Reiseziele.
For a vacation or something?
Is there anywhere you'd like to go?

Fields.MenuText: The Caribbean would be nice.
How about Australia?
Maybe the Arctic Circle. See the Northern Lights.

Fields.DialogueText: Jo, I have heard great things about the Karibik. My only Sorg is that it might be a little hot. I prefer colder Klima like up by the Nordsee.
Oh, jo. There are so many different things I could explore and learn there.
Ah! And breathe in the brisk, schudderige Luff.
Esu, that won't be for a while, anyway.
You never know. Even if we don't put in for a new assignment, I don't expect these patrols to last indefinitely. We're definitely having an impact on the local Morgana infestation.
It's nice to think so.
See over there? We're about to do it again.
Jawohl!
@BATTLE
"Brisk" is certainly one way of putting it.
Wouldn't that be lovely?
To answer your Frog, though: nä. Not exactly. It's just that, as a Scheff in the Neutralitätsflotte, I - we - can volunteer for a wider range of Patouillen than I ever could before.
If we're going to be fighting endless waves of Morganas anyway, why not do it somewhere tropical?
Esu, it would have to have strategischen Wert as well. Otherwise, it would just be a Urlaub - albeit a loud one.
Well, the enemy seems to be tinkering with the weather at the Equator and trying to colonize the Arctic. I'm afraid we're not lacking for conflict zones of strategic value.
If there's any general area you'd like to go, I'm afraid there's a decent chance that there's a good reason to do it.
What about you?
What *about* me?
Dummkopf-
She says affectionately...
Mein Gott.
One of the few morally unassailable pleasures of warfare is dreaming about what you'll do when it's done, Hauptsturmführer. Relax.
Herr Kapitän, you can't allow-
Herr Hauptsturmführer, I absolutely can.
Need some help with these crates? I can have some men take them to the storage area if you wish.
Nä - ävver danke. These are actually some more Bücher I had shipped in. I was in the Prozess of moving them to my Kajüte.
In that case, want me to help you with that? It's not like I have much else going on at the moment.
Go right ahead - danke. Just take the other end of the Kess.
Got it.
Actually, I've found that if I leave Kesse mit Bücher blocking the Pooz to my Kajüte when I leave, he can't get in to snoop at all.
So, you're going out of your way to collect all of this scandalous fare because-?
Esu, best that they can at least üvverlevve out here, where they cannot harm the Vaterland - or be harmed by it.
You know, I sometimes have trouble gauging where you stand with the Nazis.
Frooch mich Ens. That being said, if I can do something small that does not interfere with my jude Ehre, so be it.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't there the chance they will get destroyed out here if we sink?
You have a good heart, Köln.
What if Heimlich does out about this little stash?

Fields.DialogueText: Then it would be the same as if they had been verbrannt, ävver at least they will have lived for a few Dage more. And I will do my best to protekt them.
Danke. I do my best - even when the Situation back home really testet my honor and vision.
I have faith in our ability to avoid that outcome.
If it's all right with you, I may like to read a couple of these sometime.
Dat kanns jähn dun. Just please return them after you are fädich.
Of course. This one looks interesting: "Der 9. November".
... An Event close to my Hätz. Ävver that Geschichte will have to wait for another Zigg.
Yeah, these Morganas never give us a break.
Ah, geh fott! I do not wish to lose my Schätze here so soon.
@BATTLE
By the way, what about the Antarctic?
What about the Antarktis?
As a travel destination. You'd get that chill you enjoy, and you might get to see penguins.
Pinguine!
Look at you smiling. Just lights up the room!
You're making a Jux.
I'm really not. I-
Wait. Sorry to change the subject, but... just out of curiosity, these books I'm carrying?
Jo?
Are they *all* banned in Germany, or just most of them?
Versteh schon. It's difficult to keep track.
Uh-huh. How are you planning on hiding these from Heimlich? More feminine hygiene covers?
If your door's blocked, how do you... sorry, Belle Magic. Stupid question.
Allt jud. You don't have to be clever when you're as schnuckelig as you are.
Very few of my childhood teachers agreed when I tried to make that exact point, oddly enough.
Another Fein im Aanmasch! Let's give it our all!
Good. I'm glad that's finally done with.
Heidewitzka, Herr Kapitän, ready to let loose? The Fier just about to begin.
Coming, Köln. I have to say, you've done a great job in organizing the parties lately. Even Heimlich seems happier, now that he has official documents to write angrily on.
Danke! I owe it all to your suggestion. I enjoy being a part of the Fier, ävver actually managing it has really immersed me into the Komplexitäten of it.
That's good to hear. Any special events planned for this one?
Not much other than the drowning of the Marzanna.
Oh, I see - drowning?! Who's Marzanna?
It's more of a Metapher in Polen for the Sensemann.
I see. It's a sort of cleansing of darkness ritual.
Akkurat. I think that we should be feere more than our Sieg - we should also be rejoicing that we have come out levvend - and held off the Sensemann for a bit more Zigg.

Fields.MenuText: I like how you're bringing different ideas into the mix for the parties.
Let's hope we can stay together in this world for quite a long time still.
Rather than focus on death, let's toast to a long life.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke. I've really appreciated the chance to open things up to new possibilities.
Same here. Nit sure if that will happen, ävver we can still try.
Indeed. Prost!
So come on! It's almost Zigg.
Okay, let's go. So this is the sacrifice? I notice that you modeled the dummy off a Morgana.
I thought it would more accurately represent the Dod we avoided.
Yep, it certainly does. And at least this version will sink and stay down there.
Still, I know we will prove triumphant when trouble comes later. For now, let's enjoy this Moment of peace.
@BATTLE
Hmm... This is kind of tricky...
What are you working on?
Oh, a little Modifikation I was thinking of adding to myself.
Oh? I didn't know you were interested in engineering.
Well, I'm not particularly skilled at it, ävver I can still think up Ideen. And then I can wörk with others to make it happen.
That's a good way to balance your own knowledge with others. You're becoming a great leader.
Danke. Still, I wonder if my Idee will wörk.
What is it?
A Kompressionssystem, such that my size can condense and expand as needed.
... Like an accordion.
You know me like a hand knows a glove, all right. Still, what do you think of my Vision?

Fields.MenuText: Just be careful about burning bridges - or building them onto yourself, I mean.
Is this so you can have more room for the gardens? If so, you may want to just focus on the overall goal of expanding yourself.
It's an interesting idea - and I'm impressed with the concept art, at least.

Fields.DialogueText: I get what you're saying. If I change myself, it will be nearly impossible to go back to the old me. Still, I want to keep growing, and move toward the future.
Well, the Garten ist only part of et jroße Janze. Ävver anyway, I think that being small does have its own Vorteile as well; I want to visit as many places as I can.
Danke! I'm pretty happy about the sketches.
In any case, I think you're going about this in a fairly creative way - though I'm still a little confused what it's for.
Oh, how silly of me to forget. You see...
*ALARM*
Looks like we'll need to save our chat for later. One more thing though - I don't know if you can stretch yourself like an accordion, but can you twist those guys like a broken one?
I'll see what I can do. No matter what, they'll be singing a different tune when we're done with them!
@BATTLE
Lach nit!
I would *never* presume to mock the most noble of all musical instruments. The punishment would be swift and severe.
... I want to be able to stay at Köln, somehow, when I'm ald.
So, you were saying about your design? Before we were so rudely interrupted...
Jo. You see, the reason I want to be able to expand and contract as I wish is to fulfill my dream to become a Schull.
A school?
Mm-hm. I've always enjoyed teaching others, and wörking with you has reignited my Passion.
I can definitely see you as a teacher. Still, even with your compression plan you won't have the most room for a school.
Well, it can be a smaller one. That holds its own type of Scharm, I suppose. You can be more personalized that way. Besides, I sort of have another Traum connected to it.
What's that?
I want to cruise the world and explore its many sights and stories. That's why I've always liked being a Lihrer - it's a way to learn more about the world and then share your discoveries.

Fields.MenuText: I have that sort of dream as well. Let's chase that promise together.
I have full faith in your ability to succeed in your wishes.
Don't be afraid to just enjoy life and do as you want. There's a lot to do if you have the freedom and desire.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you might have that same Wunsch. Our Wege may diverge or stay congruent on this vast world. Ävver either way, I know that we will grow stronger through our bond.
Danke for putting your trust in me, all this Zigg. I was a little unsure at first, ävver now I am determined to fulfill my Dräume, and those of my Schüler.
I know, and someday I might like to have a worldwide Urlaub. ävver I also like watching - and helping - others grow.
Well, I'm not sure what will happen with your school idea, but I look forward to seeing it in action once the war's done. If we get that far, that is.
Don't worry, Kapitän. We, and the world as a whole, are building up our strength. Soon, we will push past the Nixen and be able to seize the future.
Until then, best to pay attention in our impromptu "study sessions." And it looks like one's just about to start.
@BATTLE
I feel the same way.
And you're definitely good at it, too.
Watching a cartoon on the projector?
Jo, it's an interessantes Medium, and I feel that in the future it will be important to improving education.
That, and it's fun to watch. I noticed you laughing over there.
Esu, it is kind of a nice pleasure I have every now and then. It's another way of storytelling, after all. You just have to admire the Lück who perform in that way.
In that case, why not try it out yourself?
I was just thinking that! Ävver Heimlich just finished scolding me for running from one Projekt to the next like a little Mädche looking for new toys...
I don't believe I have to say this, but - ignore him. You mentioned how you thought this could help with learning, right? Isn't it ultimately all part of the same project?
You know... this could wörk. It sounds like something really juxich that I could dive in. Still... I'm never really been an actress or performer. Do you think I would do all right?

Fields.MenuText: If it's for your own enjoyment, what matters is the experience itself, right?
Just think of this as another way to grow as a teacher.
You already have the heart of a performer - for one, you're great with the accordion.

Fields.DialogueText: Juder Punk - succeed or fail, I want to take on the biggest challenges the world can offer. Bring it on!
Do häs Rääch, I can use this to take my Traum to a new level.
It's villeich a little different actually acting, ävver close enough. In any case, you have a point
Danke for the Idee, Kapitän. Now I need to start practicing for my Debüt - in addition to my other wörk.
Sorry to divert you on those.
Allt jud. This sounds like it will be very interessant for me. Think you might want to participate?
Sure. Though what I wouldn't give for stunt doubles right now.
If you had them, the Schauspiller would probably insist the Nixen get them as well. As if they don't have enough Tricks im sleeve already.
@BATTLE
Besides, nothing wrong with cultivating different interests.
Esu, Kapitän, do you want to try a Duett with our Instrumente?
Sure. I've gotten a lot better lately.
As have I. It will be interessant to see how our Musik coincides.
Okay, let's get started. A one, a two, a one-two-three!
So far, so good! You're keeping in Takt pretty well, too.
Thanks! You're leading the way, though.
Nä, I feel the best part is actually the Trömmelche in the background. However did you are arrange it?
Percussion? Wait, that's a Morgana. We need to call off the song.
Nä. Let us continue.
Pardon me?
Ävver we're already halfway through, so we may as well finish what we started. Besides, I will not let these Rabauken drown out our Musik of hope.

Fields.MenuText: I guess this will help keep morale up.
Even so, we need to get ready for the attack.
Well, at least the "percussion" will enhance the drama of our concert.

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I was thinking. If we just spill this for a little longer, our Lück will hold the line against the Nixen.
You can, ävver I'm going to keep spille. I can do several things jlichzick, after all.
That's the spirit! It's in conditions like this that you can find true wonder, whether in strength, mind, or art.
Okay, we might as well keep going. The climax is the best part.
Do häs Rääch. That Nixe cannot stop us from embracing life's Reiz.
Okay, we're done. Now it's time to make our opponent play a different tune.
@BATTLE
I promise you, we'll get to the Brücke long before they're in firing range.
Another rainy day, huh?
Tja, that's de Nature for you, always throwing in little surprises.
That said, I'll be happy if we don't have to fight anyone in this kind of weather.
If we do, we'll still make it through all right. For now, best to get some practice in.
How? It's a little too slippery for exercises on deck. We could try indoors, but it might be a little cramped.
That is a Problem, I admit - one that the Quetschbüggelspill should rectify eventually. Ävver for the exercises in mind, we won't have to worry about that.
What do you mean?
We will not have to worry about slipping because we will not be on the Deck - or Scheff - to begin with.
Wait. Are you suggesting we swim?
Warum nit? The Scheff is anchored; the Wasser is warm. We'll be wet either way, so why not make the best of things?

Fields.MenuText: What if we drown in the storm?
Why are you so interested in swimming practice?
We could work on sorting out your library instead.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, it's barely a light Nissel right now.
I want to be able to fight to my last breath, even if I sink to the bottom of the Meer. Plus, I enjoy becoming one with the Wasser.
That's also a jude Idee, ävver that is part of why I wish to improve my Schwemme.
And, come on, you're already patschnass!
Yay! Let's hurry and get on with it, before... uh, oh.
Don't fret, Köln. We can always go swimming when we're done with the fight.
I suppose you're right. And maybe the Nixen will leave behind a few goodies for us to find when we dive.
@BATTLE
And we're out here because Heimlich isn't?
There are plenty of Orte Heimlich isn't. I'm out here because I like the Rähn.
I guess I'm out here because I like *you*.
All right, just for a little bit.
"Barely a...?" I can't see anything but rain more than three feet from my face.
You're exaggerating. Besides, if something did happen, I'm strong and I wouldn't let you afsaufe!
Most of all, I love... no. This is tougher than I thought.
Hey, Köln. How's it going?
Kapitän! I... was just...
Trying to practice being an actress? Don't be so hard on yourself; you're just getting started.
... Right. Jo, it's been kind of tricky. Then again, I'm not sure if "actress" is the right term for what I have in mind.
What do you mean?
Well, I'm more interested in getting the education out there through Film, so does it really count as acting or is it more like lihren?

Fields.MenuText: You know, you could always take a management role to get things rolling.
Perhaps not, but storytelling is a good way to engage audiences in topics.
Don't worry too much about it. Just be yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Jude Idee. I'm already wörking to take on a stronger Föhrungsroll here, so this would make a good next step.
Juder Punk. I want to take a kreativen approach to education anyways.
Do häs rääch. I just want to help people learn more about the world.
Danke for the advice, Kapitän. I might try a little acting when I have the Zigg.
You're welcome. Hey, though, if you weren't practicing that before, what were you doing?
Well, I...
*ALARM*
Saved by the Gong! Or the Nixen, to be precise. Come on, we need to get ready!
But why - oh, never mind. You Morganas sure know how to stop a conversation dead in its tracks, don't you?
Don't worry, they're the ones who'll end up dud this time.
@BATTLE
Planning out the film, I see.
Jo, though I'm having a little trouble. The tricky part is deciding exactly what the overall Thems will be.
I can imagine. There are a lot of different subjects you can teach people.
Do häs Rääch. And I'm not sure which approach would be besser. Do you have any Ideen?
You're the one with all the reference books blocking your door.
I know; I need to determine my own Kurs in this. Ävver, I appreciate getting second opinions from those I trust.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe something centered around children?
Something with magic, perhaps? If you can somehow make it educational, that is.
How about a travel-themed program?

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds like potentiell the beste Option, as it's the age Lück are most ready to learn at. I don't have as much experience wörking with Pänz, ävver it's just one more thing to learn.
Jo, I think that could wörk. Stories have a value of their own as knowledge. And there are plenty of Märchen to draw from in Germany.
That sounds jud! And we're getting firsthand experience right now that we can apply to the Show.
Anyway, I hope that helps.
Dut et. Even within a narrowed-down Fokus, there are plenty of different things we can bring into the Mix.
"We?"
Esu, I was hoping, maybe...
Sure. I just wanted to make sure you were okay with me helping.
Danke. I'm... I'm really happy you're interested in wörking with me on it.
Don't mention it. We're a team, after all. Speaking of which, we'd better load up. There's another fleet on its way.
@BATTLE
I've gotten another seven or eight complaints from Heimlich, by the way.
Sehr jud. Complaining is the best exercise he gets.
Regardless, I don't know what your resources are. I don't know what's easiest to teach.
Actually, I was thinking more about exotic Belle physics. But if you're into folklore you might think of writing to Theodor Riedel; I gather she has some useful resources.
And she's so sweet! Einkennich, ävver söß! Juder thought!
Köln, are you in -?
Avast me, ye barnacle-infested landlubber!
Waahhh! Köln!
Oh, exküs. Are you en Ordnung, Kapitän?
Just a little shocked, that's all. What's with the outfit you have there?
I thought that I might like to honor Wilhelmshaven's early piratical history.
Interesting. I... think they probably used a different dialect up in the North Sea than they did in the Caribbean.
Do häs Rääch.

Fields.MenuText: Anyway. Sure, that might be something interesting to investigate.
What made you decide to dress up and act like one? It's kind of different from your usual self.
Caribbean or German pirate, you sure fooled me. I thought we were being raided.

Fields.DialogueText: Do häs Rääch! There's always more of history to explore and share with the world.
I take my honor and duty seriously, so I wanted to see what it would be like to be the opposite of that. Also verkleiden is fun.
Danke! I was using this as practice for my acting.
Exküs I surprised you like that.
Don't worry. No harm done, after all. But why am I suddenly missing a button?
Oops, esu, I may have decided to use a real Schwäät...
Of course. Well, save your strikes for the Morgana over there - and watch where you wave it!
Et dot mir Leid. Anyway, Piraten may be long gone, ävver threats continue to ravage the Meere - unless we do something to stop them.
@BATTLE
Either way, you are still Köln.
Well, you did a good job at it - both with the acting and in passing on your knowledge.
What sort of instrument are you playing in here, Köln? It sounds different than your accordion.
Oh - hallo, Kapitän.
Hi, Köln. Sorry for the confusion - I thought I heard you playing something, but there's obviously nothing here.
Ävver I was trying out a new Instrument.
What? There's nothing in here except that hand cart over there.
That's exactly it - a wheeled Ratsche.
You can make music with that thing?
Ja! The planks are linked to the wheel, you see. As it moves, the rails vibrate.
I see. Interesting. I had no idea that such a type of music existed.
Well, it's unique to Polen, so I can understand your Konfusion. They call it Terkotka. Ävver how did I sound to you?

Fields.MenuText: It sounded like a loading cart on the move.
It definitely has its own unique melody.
A little squeaky, but still pretty good.

Fields.DialogueText: Well of course, Dumkopf! That's what it is, after all.
Danke. I like unique Instrumente like it and the Quetschbüggele.
The squeaks were probably from the wheels; I need to öl them a little.
Anyway, this is pretty neat. I guess this is one way to make music while you work.
Akkurat. And with my strength, I could probably push the cart to play it while also playing my Quetschbüggele.
Interesting. Though... I might avoid being too conspicuous about using Polish instruments around our Polish crew members.
I'm sorry, but given what's going on over there...
Jo, that is a Problem. Where is the line between serving our Lück and denying others their rights? I... esu, for now, I will fight out here for my Land. All that needs to be said.
@BATTLE
In front of Heimlich, anyway.
I'd honestly rather think about Nixen.
Polish history books? In Polish? Heimlich would hate these.
If we had stopped at giving the Germans of Altpreußen their country back, what we had done might be justified. Ävver I see no stopping. I think what we nu doon... I don't see it ending well.
... I'm sorry.
Do you remember that Buch you asked me about before?
Something about a revolt?
Jo. The mutiny at Kiel, where I was built, toppled the Kaiser's government and led to the Weimarer Republik.
Wow. Were you there?
Nä, ävver my connection to the Stadt - along with many of my Schwestern - makes that an important part of our past. Some flee from the Erennerung, ävver I make sure to remember.
Why?
In part because there's another Aspekt of the tale: before the mutiny broke out in Kiel, the initial tensions began in Wilhelmshaven.
Another city you value.
Präziss. What I have learned from that story is the importance of the Lück, and how even a few can make a difference.
Then why haven't you done anything?
That's exactly it. The Lück continue to support the current Regime, and I do not want to conquer them in turn. One day, they will find the courage to stand up for truth and freedom.

Fields.MenuText: But suppose they need some individuals like you mentioned to set the stage for the revolution?
Maybe they're all waiting for someone else to step forward, like you are.
How long until that day comes?

Fields.DialogueText: Juder Punk. They continue to be drawn in by the Fuhrer's Persona. Until there is someone else to inspire them another direction, perhaps nothing will change.
I never thought of it like that. This kreiert a Problem; someone has to ring the bell on the cat.
...Isch weiß nit. I thought it would have come by now, ävver I still wait.
Maybe you're right. I need to take a firmer stance on things.

Fields.MenuText: Just do what you feel is right.

Fields.DialogueText: I will. Perhaps all of us out here can stand as a Sigenal for change in this world - unlike the Nixe, who would rather have us descend to further Düüsterheid.
@BATTLE
Then maybe he should be forced to read them.

Fields.MenuText: Be smart about it, though.
That's not necessarily what I was saying. A Belle going about it the wrong way could make things worse.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't envy you your Position, you know. The Politik.
At least I meet interesting people.
Maybe.
Would it distress you if I was... unusually serious for a Moment?
No. What's on your mind?
And I can't say anything about it. That's the whole point of Herr Heimlich and his lot.
... He's mostly bluster, you know. And even if he wasn't, there's not much they can do to you if we don't let them do it. They can tank in INPF, but scuttling a Belle who doesn't want to be scuttled?
They can get at you. I think that's why nobody protestiert too loudly if Walküre and Kapitän... if we form attachments. You're the best leverage they have.
So, Köln, what did you want to talk to me about?
I have been thinking about a lot of things. About my Träume, about my honor, and about what must be done.
...Okay? And?
Esu, I think the biggest Problem is that, right now, the most important thing is dealing with the Nixen out here. Their Nevvel have poisoned more Zivilisten to date than any Armee has shot.
You have a point there.
Ävver, if we want things to change - if we want people to start seeking change - we have to set an example for them.
What do you have in mind?
I want to start a Walküre-oriented, communal classroom setting out here, where we can share our knowledge with each other, and then broadcast some of the Kurse globally.
... Have you happened to get in touch with Emden?
Jo, ävver we have a lot of the Material and Lück with us now. We all have our own Geschichten to tell, and this way we can all help each other grow.
And also show the importance of cooperation to the world.
Präziss. Perhaps then they will know that things need to move in a new direction.

Fields.MenuText: What can I do to help?
You really came up with a great idea here, as it brings a lot of your visions together.
In that case, we had better get started on this right away.

Fields.DialogueText: I could use your Assistenz in setting things up. We make a judes team, after all.
Danke. I feel like I have finally found something I can do that will really make a difference for everyone.
Jo, there's no Zigg to waste!
Well, we should start talking to the other Belles about the proposal, then. And I might know a few people at the League who-
I have already started recruiting a few.
You have? You've sure come a long way, Köln.
Esu... that's because you have helped me grow so much, Kapitän.
Heimlich's going to be looking all over this for even a whiff of sedition, of course. And the Morgana have to remain our top priority.
I understand. And unfortunately, none of them ever seem to give us a break.
@BATTLE
She's interessiert. Not least because the Idee comes from silly little Köln!
Ah, stop it.
Anyway. It's a big undertaking.
Only because you ask so kindly.
That's not true, though I appreciate the flattery.
Hang in there, little ones. I won't let you down.
Köln, what are you doing outside in this weather?
The wind is tearing away at the Gaade. Quick, help me with these Plafonds!
But the wind's strong enough to blow you away as well!
Ävver, this Gaade is very precious to me. I will protect it to the best of my abilities.
I'm just a little worried about you being here alone, Köln.
I'm not alone. My Gaade is here as well. I will not fail in their trust in me.

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes you can be stubborn to a fault, you know?
Köln, you mean a lot to me. I don't want to lose you.
I guess there's no way I can stop you; when you want to help others, you do everything you can, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I know, ävver that's just a part of who I am. I would fight on even if I sprung a Leck.
Danke, Kapitän. I don't want to lose you either. Ävver we have our Flich out here, and de Sensemann is always a possibility.
Jo, that's what makes me me. Exküs about that.
All right, I guess I can't stop you. What can I do to help?
Wat? Kapitän, it's dangerous out here!
That's what I just said! But it's you and me!
... Danke. Here, you can help me with these Blome over on the side.
There! Everything should be safe from the storm.
Now the only thing they are at risk from is the Feind - and it looks like we'll have to handle that duty as well.
We'll keep everyone safe, together.
@BATTLE
It's okay. It's a wonderful part of your character.
I know. And even while it gives me a lot of stress, it's another part of you that I lo...like.
Mieh Nixen! Come on, let's give it our all!
@BATTLE
Well, that's finally over. And now, it's time to party!
Seriously, you've done a great job at figuring out the parties, Köln.
Danke. Ävver I couldn't have done it without your guidance. I'm glad that you've grown to like them, too.
Well, they get a little wild sometimes - and we still need to stay on guard for the Morganas - but they help keep morale up, and they are kind of fun.
I know, right? It was a great Idee of yours for me to try to organise some of them myself.
Yeah. Say, Köln...
Jo?
Might you be able to teach me how to run them as well, please?
Learn more from me in that regard? Sure. Ävver what made you interessiert?

Fields.MenuText: It sounds like a great way to spend time with you.
Just as you learned how to make parties that I can enjoy, I want to make parties that help you feel the same way.
It just seems like a lot of fun.

Fields.DialogueText: That would be jude Sach, wouldn't it? I think we both bring out the best in each other when we're a team, or more than that.
That's very scharmant of you, Kapitän.
Jo, ävver remember to take things seriously. Much must be accounted for in order to ensure everyone has fun.
Okay, I'll show you the ropes. It's the least I can do for you getting me involved with the Prozess.
Thanks.
On another note, Kapitän... Now's not the beste Zigg. Ävver later, do you think we can talk?
Sure. About what?
That's the surprise.
Oh? Well, everything's a learning experience with you, I guess.
I know, that's why I suggested you take it on. And now I'm ready for that challenge as well.
Herr Kapitän, I know it's not my place to question the Entschidungen you make as regards the Moral of the Mannschaft, but I must once again-
Exküs mich, Hauptsturmführer Heimlich, ävver the Smut was hoping for your opinion on his new Rezepp for Gebrannte Mandeln.
You're in for a treat. I hear they're the best candied almonds anyone here can recall.
Ich... also... we'll talk later, Herr Kapitän!
... They really are good, huh?
Ja. I'm afraid Heimlich will be rather annoyed to learn I brought you the last Blech.
You didn't.
You'll know if you hear shouting in a Minute.
And we call the Morganas monsters.
Ah, Kapitän! I'm glad that you could find the Zigg to meet with me.
The pleasure is mine. So, what did you wish to discuss?
A lot of things have changed for the both of us, you know. We're both growing and finding new directions for ourselves.
Well, that's the way life goes.
Indeed, and it is good to continue to foster that feeling of exploration in Lück. Still, even as things change, I want for us to stay...no, I want us to converge in a new direction.
What do you mean?
You have done so much for me, and with me. You helped me become a Föhrer, to overcome challenges, and to find a new Wäch for myself.
You've helped me become stronger too. "Stronger" doesn't even begin to cover it, really.
I know. And that's why I want us to bond even deeper. More than as just Kameraden, or Frünne.
Wait, so you're saying...?
Kapitän, I really like you a lot. Nä, not that; Isch han disch jään.
I... Köln, I love you as well.
You do? I'm so excited to learn that!
I mean, you must have guessed from my willingness to die in a hurricane to protect your potatoes.
Go out with me! I don't care where, I don't care what we do.
Okay. Okay, it's my turn to think up a happy surprise.
Ävver kei Heimlich!
I'll restrict my plans to rooms whose doors are blocked with towers of books.
Esi they are *very* jude Äädäppel.
But they won't be perfect until you've bred them to be accordion-shaped.
Dummkopf.
Gorgeous.
